entry.title: Modern miracles
entry.content:
It's become routine but I will never get over having lived to see pictures actually being sent to Earth from Mars. Just astounding.

Absolutely crazy thin blades of surprisingly competent eroded rock in @MarsCuriosity image http://t.co/UDw4PBaFlk pic.twitter.com/q49mIbS9s4
— Emily Lakdawalla (@elakdawalla) March 27, 2014

entry.title: Sad day
entry.content: Today would have been my Dad's 86th birthday if he had lived to see it. I bought garden plants because that's what I did for his birthday for the last twenty years of his life. My soul brother Mark Herschler's new song seems to be the only thing I have to say today. Reminds me of how much I miss my Happy Valley family as well. It's been that kind of day.

entry.title: Amazing art
entry.content:
Well, not as colorful, yet this is just as cool as the guy who does the sidewalk art.
Amazing art by Ben Heine pic.twitter.com/tBWqsIshl7
— Sexy Summer (@LeahyTrahanqip) January 31, 2014

entry.title: Nice Ice
entry.content:
Probably not the best picture to post when everyone is so sick of winter, but hey, sometimes the cold can be beautiful. Niagara Falls frozen again in the last polar vortex. Hoping this is the last gasp of this endless winter. [photo credit - more photos at link]



[Photos are better if you click on them to embiggen.]

entry.title: Places I have been
entry.content:
The Majestic Diner on Ponce de Leon in Atlanta is  famous for its cheese grits. It's a real classic in its genre. The first time I ever had grits was there. It was one of only two times that I really enjoyed eating grits in all the years I've now lived in the South.



[Photos are better if you click on them to embiggen.]

entry.title: Updating the bucket list
entry.content:
Had no idea this place existed but definitely putting it near the top of the bucket list. I love beach glass. Glass Beach, Fort Bragg, California. [image via]



[Photos are better if you click on them to embiggen.]

entry.title: So sweet
entry.content: Possibly the most heartwarming ad for alcohol I've ever seen and I've watched every Budweiser ad ever aired. It even beats that Coke ad with the football guy.

Been crazy busy with real life so posting still is erratic. Thanks for sticking with me. Here, have an edible collage.



[Photos are better if you click on them to embiggen.]

entry.title: Spring will be here before you know it
entry.content:
sorry I haven't posted. Been busy with real life. Anyway, thinking with this endless winter, it's a good time to post something from the tropics. My friends are on an anniversary trip. From their gorgeous photo album. Yellow flowers in Puerto Rico. [Russell Alan Brooks photo]

entry.title: Don't know much about history
entry.content:
I always loved the airport in the town I grew up in but I had no idea that the did this. If I had been alive in 1929, I would have been saving my pennies for as long as it took to take this ride.



[Photos are better if you click on them to embiggen.]

I've posted photos of this before. It's beautiful in every season. I should probably go see it in person some day. The Japanese Garden in Portland, Oregon. [photo via]



[Photos are better if you click on them to embiggen.]

entry.title: Places I have been
entry.content:
I'm still alive but I did have a bit of a relapse of the bronchitis and I've been busy with some real life stuff.  I'm trying to get back to a posting schedule. May be a few more days but for now, here's a couple of photos from the time I spent in Tulum.

The first night we arrived, we were too late to get a cabana. The only sleeping quarters we could get was this little pup tent.



Victoria and I could barely squeeze into it together. In the middle of the night I felt something warm and hairy. At first I thought it was Victoria's leg, but then realized it was breathing. It was an animal. I freaked out and sprang out of the tent screaming.  Moments later Victoria was laughing hysterically.



Turns out the animal was this little puppy. He tried to steal my wallet in the morning. His owners just watched and laughed as he ran off with it. Maybe that's how they made a living on the beach.  He made a hell of a cute thief.


[Photos are better if you click on them to embiggen.]

entry.title: A rhapsody in blue
entry.content:
Since most of America is freezing, something to warm the soul. Blue butterflies in the Amazon. I've seen a few in the tropics but never a whole tree full of them. [photo via]



[Photos are better if you click on them to embiggen.]
